byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and NIKI KITSANTONIS
byline.contributor: Stephen Castle reported from Brussels and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.

abstract: France unveils details of its recapitalization plan for its banks while the European Commission prepares to makes its own proposals public; plans emerge as Greece clears a major hurdle that will allow it to avoid default on its debt.
snippet: France unveiled recapitalization details for its banks, while the European Commission prepared to make its proposals public on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: France unveiled recapitalization details for its banks, while the European Commission prepared to make its proposals public on Wednesday.

headline.main: As Greece Avoids a Default, Recapitalization Plans Emerge for European Banks
headline.print_headline: As Greece Avoids a Default, Recapitalization Plans Emerge for European Banks
headline.seo: Aid Plans Emerge for Europe’s Banks
